pages.text: This book cannot possibly cover everything there is to discover, unless it ended up being a full on textbook. However, $(thing)JEI (Just Enough Items)/$ is a great way to explore beyond what this book discusses.$(br2)Anyone with previous experience with modded Minecraft should find this familiar, but for those who aren't it is effectively an index of every relevant item or block in the game.

Hovering over an item in the panel to the right of your inventory, you can $(bold)Left Click/$ and entry to view all the recipes to make that item. You can also $(bold)Right Click/$ to show all the recipes that item is used in, or recipes using that block for things such as a crafting table. You can also press $(bold)$(k:jei.showRecipe)/$ or $(bold)$(k:jei.showUses)/$, respectively, to do the same. These keybinds also work from any inventory menu.

Some items or blocks will also show additional tabs with relevant information. Items can also be $(bold)$(l:getting_started/ponder)Pondered/$ directly from within $(thing)JEI/$.$(br2)Additionally, you can press $(bold)$(k:jei.bookmark)/$ while hovering over an item to bookmark an item to the left tab for later reference, or press $(bold)$(k:findme.search)/$ to highlight nearby inventories which contain that same item. These will both work from any inventory menu, or the $(thing)JEI/$ panel itself.
